00072 typedef struct
00073     {
00074     char *section;
00075     char *name;
00076     char *value;
00077     } CONF_VALUE;
00078 
00079 DECLARE_STACK_OF(CONF_VALUE)
00080 DECLARE_STACK_OF(CONF_MODULE)
00081 DECLARE_STACK_OF(CONF_IMODULE)
00082 
00083 struct conf_st;
00084 typedef struct conf_st CONF;
00085 struct conf_method_st;
00086 typedef struct conf_method_st CONF_METHOD;
00087 
00088 struct conf_method_st
00089     {
00090     const char *name;
00091     CONF *(*create)(CONF_METHOD *meth);
00092     int (*init)(CONF *conf);
00093     int (*destroy)(CONF *conf);
00094     int (*destroy_data)(CONF *conf);
00095     int (*load_bio)(CONF *conf, BIO *bp, long *eline);
00096     int (*dump)(const CONF *conf, BIO *bp);
00097     int (*is_number)(const CONF *conf, char c);
00098     int (*to_int)(const CONF *conf, char c);
00099     int (*load)(CONF *conf, const char *name, long *eline);
00100     };

00134 /* New conf code.  The semantics are different from the functions above.
00135    If that wasn't the case, the above functions would have been replaced */
